Class.name: FamiliarTracker

TunableTuple.name: ACTIVE_FAMILIAR_BUFF
TunableTuple.description: The buff that will be given to the Sim when they have an active familiar.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableList.name: FAMILIAR_DATA
TunableList.description: A mapping between the familiar type and data associated with that familiar type.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The type of familiar associated with this data.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Data associated with a specific familiar type.

TunableVariant.name: familiar_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of familiar this is. Object Familiars have a special object associated with them that is created whenever the Sim is created and has an interaction pushed on the owning Sim to places the pet familiar in a routing formation with the owning Sim. Pet Based Familiars are instead based on Pets and rely on the Pet's autonomy to drive most behavior with the familiar.

TunableTuple.name: object_based_familiar
TunableTuple.description: Data related to Object Based Familiars.

Tunable.name: familiar_description
Tunable.description: The description of this familiar as it appears in the familiar rename dialogs.

Tunable.name: familiar_object
Tunable.description: The definition of the familiar object that will be created.

Tunable.name: familiar_token_object
Tunable.description: The definition of the familiar token object that will be created and played into the user's inventory when the familiar is unbound.

Tunable.name: follow_affordance
Tunable.description: The specific affordance to follow a familiar.

TunableEnum.name: name_list
TunableEnum.description: The name list associated with this familiar type. Since familiars don't have any specific gender associated with them we always just use Male names.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: The icon of the familiar within the picker.

Tunable.name: FAMILIAR_ENSEMBLE
Tunable.description: The ensemble to place pet familiars in with their master.

TunableTuple.name: FAMILIAR_PLACEMENT
TunableTuple.description: Method for placing the familiar's initial position based on the Sim.

Class.TunableTuple:
<TunableVariant type="None" name="max_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Max Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid." group="General">
<TunableVariant type="None" name="min_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Min Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid." group="General">
<TunableVariant type="None" name="max_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Max Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid." group="General">
<TunableVariant type="None" name="min_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Min Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid." group="General">

Tunable.name: randomize_orientation
Tunable.description: If checked, object will be spawned using a random orientation. Otherwise, it will use the orientation of the target object.

TunableVariant.name: raytest
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will run a raytest to make sure that the object remains within LOS.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Data related to running a raytest to a position.

Tunable.name: raytest_end_height_offset
Tunable.description: The height offset of end point of the ray. 1.5 is the height of a Sim.

Tunable.name: raytest_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of the ray. 0.1 is acceptable for a line of sight check.

Tunable.name: raytest_start_height_offset
Tunable.description: The height offset of the start height. 1.5 is the height of a Sim.

TunableVariant.name: starting_position
TunableVariant.description: Use either the previously calculated starting point or perform a raytest in regards to a specific participant.

TunableEnum.name: use_participants_location
TunableEnum.description: A partcipant's location that we will perform the raytest to.

TunableList.name: reference_obj_hidden_flags
TunableList.description: Hidden reasons we allow when retrieving the reference object.

Tunable.name: remove_from_parent_slot
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will be removed from the slot they are parented to when placed in a new location.

TunableList.name: search_flag_set
TunableList.description: Set of flags for FGL Search that will be enabled if present in list. If you're unsure how these flags work, consult your GPE partner.

Tunable.name: skip_plex_starting_position_validation
Tunable.description: If checked, placement of the object will not restrict the starting point of the placement search to inside of the active plex when doing an on-lot placement. For example, if your reference starting point is an object in a common area outside of an apartment unit like a trash chute, and you want to spawn trash next to that trash chute, you would want to check this.

Tunable.name: stay_in_connected_connectivity_group
Tunable.description: If unchecked then the object will be allowed to be placed in a connectivity group that is currently disconnected from the starting location. If checked then the placement will fail if there is not a position inside a connected connectivity group from the starting position that can be used for placement.

Tunable.name: stay_outside_placement
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will run their placement search only for positions that are considered outside.

TunableVariant.name: surface_type_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will override the routing surface type of the location to whatever is tuned here. Otherwise, we use the routing surface of the initial location. Example: The initial location may be in a pool but you want the created object to be placed on the ground.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The routing surface we want to force the object to be placed on.

TunableVariant.name: terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a set of allowed terrain tags. At least one tag must match the terrain under each vertex of the footprint of the supplied object.

TunableTuple.name: FAMILIAR_SUMMON_FAILURE_NOTIFICATION
TunableTuple.description: A TNS that is displayed when the familiar fails to be summoned.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: DEPRECATED! Please use custom_mask_target_sim instead. Use InGame/UI/Icons/Dialog/phone_anonymous_caller_icon.png and UI/Gameplay/Phone:UnknownCallerName. If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description: If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting_owner
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the owner of the audio sting when the dialog is shown.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant of the interaction who will play the audio_sting.

TunableEnum.name: auto_delete_reason
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's auto-delete reason.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableVariant.name: background_image
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add a background image to the dialog. This will only be used in the case where dialog_bg_style is BG_DYNAMIC_IMAGE.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background image for the family portrait.

TunableVariant.name: custom_mask_target_sim
TunableVariant.description: When tuned, display the given icon/name for the target Sim instead of the Sim's actual icon/name.

Tunable.name: career_reference
Tunable.description: The Career to override the icon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the career.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the small business we want to get the icon from.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableVariant.name: alert_sim_name
TunableVariant.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: career_reference
Tunable.description: The Career to override the icon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the career.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the small business we want to get the icon from.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_bg_style
TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_footer_type
TunableEnum.description: An enumeration of the type for YES BUTTONS and DIALOG BUTTON footers. AUTOMATIC lets the code decide which footer to use. YES_BUTTONS_FOOTER is a footer with an OK BUTTON by default. DIALOG_BUTTONS_FOOTER is a footer with only DIALOG BUTTONS.

TunableList.name: dialog_options
TunableList.description: Options to apply to the dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_style
TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableEnum.name: expand_behavior
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's expand behavior.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an icon to be displayed.

Tunable.name: career_reference
Tunable.description: The Career to override the icon.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the career.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the small business we want to get the icon from.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be used as the owner of this dialog. If this participant doesn't exist, the default owner will be used instead.

TunableEnum.name: information_level
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's information level.

TunableList.name: override_text_mapping
TunableList.description: If enabled, we will override the TNS text depending on age

Tunable.name: override_string
Tunable.description: The alternate text that will be displayed in the TNS.

TunableVariant.name: participant
TunableVariant.description: This field is deprecated. Please use 'icon' instead.

TunableEnum.name: phone_ring_type
TunableEnum.description: The phone ring type of this dialog. If tuned to anything other than None this dialog will only appear after clicking on the phone.

TunableVariant.name: primary_icon_response
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, associate a response to clicking the primary icon.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The response associated to the primary icon.

TunableVariant.name: audio_event_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the audio event sent by this button.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The button audio event name.

TunableVariant.name: build_buy_filters
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specified category and pack id will be applied in the build buy mode

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Category tag and Pack ID to filter in build buy mode

TunableEnum.name: category_tag
TunableEnum.description: Category tag to filter in build buy mode Filters include all the buy categories

TunableEnum.name: pack_id
TunableEnum.description: Pack Id to be filtered in build buy mode

TunableVariant.name: button_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the icon to be shown on this button.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: loots_for_response
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify loots to apply and dialog response id for this response.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Loots to apply for the response and dialog response id that will override the original id.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_response_id_override
TunableEnum.description: The dialog response id for this response that will override the default response id. Make sure this is unique for each response.

TunableList.name: loots
TunableList.description: A list of loots that will be applied when the player selects this response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments
TunableList.description: The arguments for this command. Arguments will be added after the command.

TunableVariant.description: An argument being passed to the command.

TunableTuple.name: boolean
TunableTuple.description: A boolean value.

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip_text
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the tooltip text to be shown on hover for this button.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The tooltip's text.

TunableVariant.name: tutorial_id
TunableVariant.description: If set, this tutorial ID will be used for SHOW_LESSONS requests.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: ID of a Tutorial, TutorialCategory, or TutorialSubcategory to be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: ui_message_name
TunableVariant.description: If set, this UI message will be used for SEND_UI_MESSAGE requests.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Name of a UI message to be sent.

TunableVariant.name: ui_message_tuned_args
TunableVariant.description: (Requires Ui Message Name to be tuned.) If set, these message arguments will be used in SEND_UI_MESSAGE requests.

TunableTuple.description: Arguments for the UI message.

Tunable.name: argument_name
Tunable.description: The name of this argument.

TunableVariant.name: argument_value
TunableVariant.description: The value of this argument.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableVariant.name: secondary_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a secondary icon to be displayed. Only certain dialog types may support this field.

TunableVariant.name: argument_value

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableVariant.name: subtitle
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include subtitle text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's subtitle.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: The dialog's text.

TunableTuple.name: concatenation
TunableTuple.description: A list of localized string concatenations. These strings will be joined together into single line-separated string

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: single
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableTuple.name: variation
TunableTuple.description: A list of possible localized string variations.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: text_tokens
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define text tokens to be used to localized text.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the text tokens that are available to all text fields in the dialog, such as title, text, responses, default and initial text values, tooltips, etc.

TunableList.name: tokens
TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableTuple.name: animal_home
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the animal home.

TunableVariant.name: animal_home_data
TunableVariant.description: Data you'd like to fetch about the animal home.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch specified data. This is expected to resolve to an Animal Home.

TunableTuple.name: associated_club
TunableTuple.description: The token is a stored 'associated_club' on this interaction. Only works with ClubMixerInteractions or ClubSuperInteractions.

TunableTuple.name: buck_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number repesenting the amount of the specified buck type the specified participant has.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

TunableTuple.name: buff_duration_remaining
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the remaining duration of a buff

Tunable.name: buff
Tunable.description: The buff whose duration we want to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified buff duration.

TunableTuple.name: career_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized string, number, or Sim, representing the specified career data for the specified participant.

TunableVariant.name: career_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

Tunable.name: career_type
Tunable.description: The career we care about.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's whose career data we care about.

TunableTuple.name: civic_policy
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the Civic Policy system.

TunableVariant.name: civic_policy_data
TunableVariant.description: The specific value to display.

TunableTuple.name: custom_schedule_assignment
TunableTuple.description: Token for a sim's assignment preset display name.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: , The participant who's assignment name we want to display.

TunableTuple.name: definition
TunableTuple.description: A catalog definition to use as a token. This is useful if you want to properly localize an object's name or description.

TunableTuple.name: game_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized number or Sim representing the specified game component data from game component.

TunableVariant.name: game_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's from whom the game component data we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: gig_history
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display data from gig history.

TunableVariant.name: customer_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the participant representing the customer in gig history. If disabled, falls back to searching for any valid gig in history.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: TargetSim searches for provided customer sim. Lot will search for the current lot.

TunableVariant.name: gig_history_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: max_gig_result
TunableEnum.description: The worst acceptable gig result to find.

TunableEnum.name: min_gig_result
TunableEnum.description: The worst acceptable gig result to find.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose gig history we will search.

TunableTuple.name: global_policy
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display data from the tuned global policy.

Tunable.name: global_policy
Tunable.description: The global policy from which data is displayed.

TunableEnum.name: token_property
TunableEnum.description: Which property from the Global Policy Token to use. NAME will use the policy's display name, PROGRESS will use the progress made over the max progress value.

TunableTuple.name: lifestyle_brand
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a Lifestyle Brand owned by a Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who owns the lifestyle brand.

TunableTuple.name: luck
TunableTuple.description: Token for a sim's Luck level.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who's luck level we want to display.

TunableTuple.name: money_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the amount of Simoleons that were awarded in loot to the specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for whom we fetch the earned amount of money.

TunableTuple.name: object_fashion_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object fashion marketplace component and fashion marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_fashion_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object marketplace component and marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_property
TunableTuple.description: The token is a property of a game object. This could be catalog properties like its price or its rarity which is a property given by a component.

TunableEnum.name: obj_property
TunableEnum.description: The property of the object that we will request.

TunableTuple.name: object_state_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string representing the value of a specific state from the selected participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified state's value.

Tunable.name: state
Tunable.description: The state's whose value we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: participant_count
TunableTuple.description: The number of participants of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableList.name: by_set_of_references
TunableList.description: A set of references that the objects should be in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: The token is a Sim or object participant from the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: formatter
TunableVariant.description: Define the format for this token.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableList.name: by_set_of_references
TunableList.description: A set of references that the objects should be in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type_special
TunableTuple.description: The token is a specified string grabbed from a supported participant type that requires special handling. Currently supported are: I. Participants that resolve into households 1. Household Name 2. Household Description 2. Participants that resolve into zone ids 1. Lot Name 2. Lot Description 3. Name of household that lives there 4. Description of household that lives there.

TunableTuple.name: household
TunableTuple.description: Helper class used to support participants that resolve into households.

TunableVariant.name: attribute
TunableVariant.description: Which string we are interested in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Participant that resolves to a household.

TunableTuple.name: zone
TunableTuple.description: Helper class used to support participants that resolve into zone ids.

TunableVariant.name: attribute
TunableVariant.description: Which string we are interested in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Participant that resolves to zone id of a multi unit business.

TunableTuple.name: picked_part
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a picked part.

TunableTuple.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token can be used to get strings representing scholarship information from the scholarship letter component of an object.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom to get the scholarship letter component data.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: sickness
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the sickness on the specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.name: small_business
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the small business owned by specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who has small business.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

Tunable.name: clamp_value_to_floor
Tunable.description: If True, the value will be clamped to its floor.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic's whose value we want to fetch.

Tunable.name: use_statistic_name
Tunable.description: If True, the value will be the name of the statistic.

TunableTuple.name: street
TunableTuple.description: Using the Street Selector tuning, provide a token localization appropriate street selection.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableVariant.name: timeout_duration
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the timeout duration for this dialog in game time.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The time, in sim minutes, that this dialog should time out.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include title text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableVariant.name: tns_suppression_group
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the TNS will be considered for suppression. Suppression occurs if the number of notifications in this group that fire exceed the tuned TNS suppression limit.

TunableList.name: ui_responses
TunableList.description: A list of buttons that are mapped to UI commands.

TunableTuple.description: A dialog response.

TunableVariant.name: audio_event_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the audio event sent by this button.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The button audio event name.

TunableVariant.name: build_buy_filters
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specified category and pack id will be applied in the build buy mode

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Category tag and Pack ID to filter in build buy mode

TunableEnum.name: category_tag
TunableEnum.description: Category tag to filter in build buy mode Filters include all the buy categories

TunableEnum.name: pack_id
TunableEnum.description: Pack Id to be filtered in build buy mode

TunableVariant.name: button_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the icon to be shown on this button.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: loots_for_response
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify loots to apply and dialog response id for this response.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Loots to apply for the response and dialog response id that will override the original id.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_response_id_override
TunableEnum.description: The dialog response id for this response that will override the default response id. Make sure this is unique for each response.

TunableList.name: loots
TunableList.description: A list of loots that will be applied when the player selects this response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments
TunableList.description: The arguments for this command. Arguments will be added after the command.

TunableVariant.description: An argument being passed to the command.

TunableTuple.name: boolean
TunableTuple.description: A boolean value.

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: The prompt's text.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip_text
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the tooltip text to be shown on hover for this button.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The tooltip's text.

TunableVariant.name: tutorial_id
TunableVariant.description: If set, this tutorial ID will be used for SHOW_LESSONS requests.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: ID of a Tutorial, TutorialCategory, or TutorialSubcategory to be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: ui_message_name
TunableVariant.description: If set, this UI message will be used for SEND_UI_MESSAGE requests.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Name of a UI message to be sent.

TunableVariant.name: ui_message_tuned_args
TunableVariant.description: (Requires Ui Message Name to be tuned.) If set, these message arguments will be used in SEND_UI_MESSAGE requests.

TunableTuple.description: Arguments for the UI message.

Tunable.name: argument_name
Tunable.description: The name of this argument.

TunableVariant.name: argument_value
TunableVariant.description: The value of this argument.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

Tunable.name: PET_FAMILIAR_BIT
Tunable.description: The relationship bit to indicate that a pet is a familiar.

TunableList.name: PET_FAMILIAR_BUFF
TunableList.description: A buff added to pet familiars based on age and species.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The age that this buff will be applied to.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The species that this buff will be applied to.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The buff that will be given to the Familiar of this age/species pair.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

Tunable.name: PET_FAMILIAR_SET_ACTIVE_AFFORDANCE
Tunable.description: An interaction pushed on pet Sims when they are set to be the active familiar.
